DataElement.preferredName: Person Plasma Cell Myeloma Stage Grouping Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: an assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage of multiple myeloma (cancer that arises in plasma cells ) for eligibility criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Plasma Cell Myeloma Stage Grouping Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the an assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage of multiple myeloma (cancer that arises in plasma cells ).

Property.preferredName: Myeloma Stage Grouping Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A bone marrow-based plasma cell neoplasm characterized by a serum monoclonal protein and skeletal destruction with osteolytic lesions, pathological fractures, bone pain, hypercalcemia, and anemia.  Clinical variants include non-secretory myeloma, smoldering myeloma, indolent myeloma, and plasma cell leukemia. (WHO, 2001) -- 2003:Stage Grouping; an assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage. (caDSR):Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A bone marrow-based plasma cell neoplasm characterized by a serum monoclonal protein and skeletal destruction with osteolytic lesions, pathological fractures, bone pain, hypercalcemia, and anemia.  Clinical variants include non-secretory myeloma, smoldering myeloma, indolent myeloma, and plasma cell leukemia. (WHO, 2001)
An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Plasma Cell Myeloma Stage Grouping Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the extent of multiple myeloma within the body for eligibility criteria.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Invasive cancer confined to the original anatomic site of growth without lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: Invasive cancer confined to the original anatomic site of growth without lymph node involvement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Invasive cancer more extensive than stage I, usually involving local lymph nodes without spread to distant anatomic sites.

Concepts.definition: Invasive cancer more extensive than stage I, usually involving local lymph nodes without spread to distant anatomic sites.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Locally advanced cancer that has spread to nearby organs but not to distant anatomic sites.

Concepts.definition: Locally advanced cancer that has spread to nearby organs but not to distant anatomic sites.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.

ReferenceDocuments.description: What is the patient's current disease status
